titlestmt.titleproper: Association of Presbyterian University Pastors records 1948-1981
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Association of Presbyterian University Pastors records

bioghist.p: The Association of Presbyterian University Pastors was an organization of chaplains working at Presbyterian universities and colleges in the United States. Membership was open to those officially appointed to their posts by the Westminster Foundation and the Board of Christian Education.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of the Association of Presbyterian University Pastors. Materials include: papers and reports on the Church and higher education, the Church and public education, peace ministries and the university, and the social responsibility of the university; programs and bulletins from installations of ministers and assistant ministers, minutes of APUP annual meetings and Executive Committee meetings, 1949-1951; and lists of APUP members. Some papers are stamped "A. Myrvin DeLapp."

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
